intro: Pterygocalyx, commonly known as the flame-of-peace, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that resemble flames, composed of numerous small, pentagonal flowers. The leaves are typically palmately lobed and have a velvety texture. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained, sandy soils.
